column3: str

The uma bugyo is eager to get the Heavensturn procession underway.
※This quest is available for a limited time only.

The Heavensturn procession will soon commence outside the Zephyr Gate. The uma bugyo cordially invites you to attend, to which end you make your way to middle La Noscea, where the uma yoriki awaits.

※Please note that you will be unable to complete this quest after the seasonal event has ended. For details, please check the Lodestone.

Shortly after you join the uma yoriki, riders from the three Grand Companies arrive with their horses to participate in the procession. When the unicolt expresses its desire to join in, the uma yoriki relents on the condition that you will be accompanying it. The main procession then departs, leaving you to make your way to the destination with the unicolt.

※You must be following the uma–no–unicolt to complete this task. Speak with it again should you become separated.

At your word, the unicolt sets off at a spirited run, and you follow after it towards the spectators gathered ahead.

※You must be following the uma–no–unicolt to complete this task. Speak with it again should you become separated.

Having delighted the crowd, the unicolt looks at you expectantly, eager to continue on its way.

※You must be following the uma–no–unicolt to complete this task. Speak with it again should you become separated.

Under your watchful eye, the unicolt safely arrives at the procession's end. There, it is warmly received by the uma yoriki and Grand Company riders, who muse about the common ground Eorzea and the Far East share in the unicorn. Your part in the festivities thus completed, you make your way back to the Aftcastle to report to the uma bugyo.

In no small part due to your assistance, the procession has fulfilled its intended purpose and more besides. Noticing the bond you have developed with the unicolt, the uma bugyo bids you take it with you. Together with your small-but-spirited companion, you look forward to the journeys in the year ahead.
Speak with the uma yoriki at the Zephyr Gate.
Speak with the uma–no–unicolt and follow its lead.
Speak with the uma–no–unicolt again and follow its lead.
Speak with the uma–no–unicolt yet again and follow its lead.
Speak with the uma bugyo in Limsa Lominsa.
Neigh! Neeeigh!
The uma–no–unicolt appears to be enjoying itself.
Even as we speak, my faithful assistants should be seeing to the final preparations at the procession's departure point.
Being immediately outside the Zephyr Gate, the people should not have trouble finding it. I daresay even you could make your own way there, little one, now that you have been around the city!
Neigh! Neeeigh!
Hehe, it does me well to see the unicolt in such good spirits.
Now, seeing as you kindly promoted the procession, it seems only natural that you attend it as well. Will you not do us the honor?
Excellent. Pray seek out the uma yoriki outside the Zephyr Gate. He can direct you to the best locations for viewing the event.
Pray seek out the uma yoriki outside the Zephyr Gate. He can direct you to the best locations for viewing the procession.
<nicker> Neigh!
The uma–no–unicolt whinnies cheerfully, eager for the procession to begin.
Ah, so you have come too! I was quite surprised when the unicolt appeared alone...
Neigh! Neigh!
In the short time it has been with you, it has become completely at ease around people. You truly have a way with beasts. Now then, those participating in the procession should be arriving soon...
Ah! These horses, might they be...
Indeed. They're the first to be brought in from the Far East after your delegation's visit years ago. Being of a breed suited to our climes, they've fared very well.
We employ them in patrols and various other duties, and they've proven themselves most dependable.
As their riders and carers both, it gives us great pride to present them before the people on the occasion of this Heavensturn!
But to have our three steeds lined up side by side... I've no doubt that mine is the finest among them!
I beg to differ! Mine has the brightest eyes, the shiniest coat, and noblest bearing! Any and all can see that it is the finest!
Hehe! As you can see, we're quite taken with our horses!

These splendid steeds will make their way together along the road, putting their gallant and majestic forms on display. A marvelous way to mark the coming of the year of the horse, I trust you'll agree!
<nicker> Neeeigh!
What's this!? You wish to join the procession!?
While I am impressed with your newfound courage, little one, I fear it would not be safe for you to run among war-trained creatures several times your size...
What will you say?
I think it'd be a great addition to the event.
I'll be there to watch over it.
Hmmm... If you will accompany it, perhaps there is no cause for concern.
And 'tis true that the people would be delighted to see our adorable mascot. Very well, you may take part!
<nicker> Neeeigh!

Let us proceed in this manner: while the Grand Company horses travel along the road, the unicolt shall run freely through the fields with you at its side. That would help the procession end on a charming accent, I believe.
Without further ado, then, the good officers and I shall set forth. We shall see you and the unicolt at the procession's end!
Neeeigh!
The uma–no–unicolt is champing at the proverbial bit to set forth.
To be deleted.
<nicker> Neeeigh!
The uma–no–unicolt is savoring the joy of running freely while being cheered on by the people.
<nicker>
The uma–no–unicolt is eager to continue on to your destination.
To be deleted.
Neigh! Neeeigh!
The uma–no–unicolt appears tremendously satisfied.
Neeeigh!
We were watching from here. You ran impressively, little one!
Hear, hear! Be it a great stallion or a growing foal, few things are more magnificent than a horse in motion!
In the Far East, 'tis believed that to behold the horse's majestic form in the new year is to pray for peace and plenty.
Furthermore, the unicorn is a symbol of the bond between our lands─a mark of friendship that shall endure for generations. These two things serve to lend the procession even greater meaning!
Neigh!
In Ishgard, the unicorn is held to be a sacred beast that assists in religious rites. 'Tis rather fitting that it should assist in Heavensturn as well.
Is that so? That is most fascinating, for the unicorn is also considered a sacred beast in the Far East, possessed of divine powers. Distant though our lands may be, we have much and more in common.
To have the little one be part of the celebration is auspicious indeed!
Neigh! Neeeigh!
Haha! Truly, a horse in motion is a magnificent sight!
With that, my fellows and I shall tend to the tidying up. In the meantime, I would be grateful if you could report to the uma bugyo. My thanks again for your invaluable aid!
Neigh!
Unless you are mistaken, the uma–no–unicolt already wishes to go for another run.
In gladness and glee do I welcome your return. By the unicolt's buoyant bearing alone, I could tell that the procession was a rousing success!
Neigh! Neigh!
You have done very well, little one, going far above and beyond your duty as a mascot. Rightly proud of yourself you may be.
Now, in the course of being at your side, our once-wary unicolt has forged a bond of trust with you. Is this not so?
Then in hope and faith do I ask that you take it with you on your journeys. In your care, I believe it can reach its full stride, and our Ishgardian friends would doubtless agree!
In parting, I bid you enjoy the Heavensturn festivities while they last. And on behalf of our delegation, I wish you health and happiness for the year ahead!
Should you wish to draw omikuji, the omikujishi has returned to offer his services for the remainder of the celebration. Seek him out for a Heavensturn fortune!
Furthermore, twelve extra fortunes have been divined this year. Keep a watchful eye on the “Prosperity” section of your omikuji, and discover what new journeys might lie in wait for you.
To be deleted.
